item.title: 波音公司报告现金消耗后寻求出售债券
item.description: 波音公司正在寻求出售多达六个部分的债券，这是该飞机制造商报告季度亏损和 39 亿美元现金消耗，以及穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将该公司的信用评级下调至垃圾级以上之后的首次债券出售。【原文：Boeing Co. is looking to sell bonds in as many as six parts, its first bond sale after the planemaker reported a quarterly loss and $3.9 billion of cash burn, and Moody’s Ratings cut the company’s credit rating to a step above junk.】

item.title: 邮报》称，印度间谍头目谋杀锡克教活动家的阴谋已被证实
item.description: 华盛顿邮报》援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道说，据称去年在美国本土杀害一名美国公民和锡克教活动家的阴谋得到了印度情报机构高层成员的批准，其中包括当时的情报机构负责人，但该报道没有透露具体身份。【原文：An alleged plot to kill a US citizen and Sikh activist on American soil last year was approved by senior-level members of India’s intelligence agency, including its chief at the time, the Washington Post reported, citing people familiar with the matter it didn’t identify.】

item.title: 南航加入 C919 大飞机交易狂潮，与双寡头竞争
item.description: 中国南方航空股份有限公司（China Southern Airlines Co., 简称 "南航"）表示将购买 100 架 Comac C919 喷气式客机，这使得这家本地飞机制造商最近接连获得订单，与波音公司和空中客车公司并驾齐驱。【原文：China Southern Airlines Co. said it will buy 100 Comac C919 jets, bolstering the streak of recent orders for the local planemaker vying for a role alongside incumbents Boeing Co. and Airbus SE.】

item.title: 能源支撑结束，德国通胀再次回升
item.description: 德国通胀率自 12 月以来首次加速上升，这凸显了欧洲中央银行的警告，即在通往 2% 目标的道路上还会有坎坷。【原文：German inflation accelerated for the first time since December, highlighting warnings by the European Central Bank that there’ll be bumps on the path back to the 2% target.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯称经济改革势头不减，但计划有所改变
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯对不得不推迟或调整作为其经济转型计划一部分的一些最大的项目没有表示出多少担忧，一位高级官员说，随着沙特王国推进其价值数万亿美元的计划，势头 "非常稳健"。【原文：Saudi Arabia signaled little concern over having to delay or adjust some of the biggest projects conceived as part of its economic transformation plan, with a top official saying momentum is “moving very steadfastly” as the kingdom presses ahead with its multi-trillion dollar program.】

item.title: 阿布扎比建筑商计划建造价值 68 亿美元的豪华住宅项目
item.description: 阿布扎比最大的房地产开发商计划加紧建设一个海滨社区，旨在为这个已成为全球最新财富避风港之一的城市中的高净值人士建造豪华住宅。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s biggest property developer plans to ramp up work on a beachfront community, where it aims to build luxury homes for high net worth individuals in a city’s that’s emerged as one of the world’s newest wealth havens.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦在国际货币基金组织访问前将关键利率维持在历史最高水平
item.description: 在国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）代表团计划于下月访问巴基斯坦以制定新的贷款计划之前，巴基斯坦中央银行将利率维持在历史最高水平。【原文：Pakistan’s central bank left its interest rate at an all-time high ahead of a scheduled visit by an International Monetary Fund mission next month to hash out a new loan program.】

item.title: 股票每天交易 390 分钟。只有 10 分钟越来越重要
item.description: 在一个标准交易日中，美国股市的正常交易时间为 390 分钟。但按照目前的发展速度，最后 10 分钟可能才是最重要的。【原文：The regular market for US equities runs for 390 minutes on a standard trading day. But at the rate things are going, eventually the last 10 might be the only ones that matter.】

item.description:

item.title: 肯尼亚暴雨后发生泥石流和洪灾，数十人丧生
item.description: 厄尔尼诺现象造成的强降雨袭击了东非国家肯尼亚，导致 100 多人在泥石流和洪水中丧生。【原文：More than 100 people have been killed in mudslides and floods in Kenya as heavy rainfall caused by El Niño weather conditions hit the East African nation.】

item.title: 据说 MM Warburg 在税务丑闻中扮演了重要角色，将探讨出售事宜
item.description: M.M. Warburg & Co.是德国最大税务丑闻的核心银行之一，据知情人士透露，该公司正在考虑出售自己，以寻求通过新的所有权结构与危机划清界限。【原文：M.M. Warburg & Co., one of the banks at the center of Germany’s biggest tax scandal, is considering a sale of itself as it seeks to draw a line under the crisis with a new ownership structure, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 迫于减亏压力，格蒂尔退出美国和欧洲市场
item.description: 在投资者要求减少损失的压力下，土耳其食品杂货配送公司 Getir 将退出剩余的国际市场。【原文：Turkish grocery delivery company Getir will quit its remaining international markets following pressure from investors to cut losses.】

item.title: 卡塔尔向中国订购 60 亿美元液化天然气运输船
item.description: 卡塔尔能源公司（QatarEnergy）与中国船舶工业集团公司签署了一项价值 60 亿美元的协议，将建造 18 艘液化天然气运输船，准备提高其超冷冻燃料的产量。【原文：QatarEnergy has signed a $6 billion agreement with China State Shipbuilding Corp. to build 18 liquefied natural gas carriers as it prepares to boost its output of the super-chilled fuel.】

item.title: 价值超过 10 亿美元的马士基部门将分拆交易
item.description: A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S将于周二分拆其拖船公司，分析师预计此举将使这家运输巨头的市值缩水5%以上。【原文：A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S is spinning off its towage company on Tuesday in a move analysts expect to slash the transportation giant’s market value by more than 5%.】

item.title: 欧洲电力剧烈波动表明需要灵活技术
item.description: 欧洲的电价波动越来越剧烈，凸显了市场对更灵活资产的需求。【原文：Europe’s power-price swings are getting more extreme, highlighting the need for more flexible assets in the market.】

item.title: 埃利奥特的住友持股反映了日本日益高涨的激进主义情绪
item.description: 埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Management Corp.）收购了住友商事公司（Sumitomo Corp.）的大量股份，这是该公司在日本进行的一系列交易中的最新一笔，反映出激进投资者在这个东亚国家日益增长的影响力。【原文：Elliott Management Corp. buying up a sizable stake in Sumitomo Corp. is the latest in a string of Japanese deals for the firm, and reflects the growing influence of activist investors in the East Asian country.】

item.title: 爱尔兰国内生产总值（GDP）部分反弹，欧元区初现端倪
item.description: 爱尔兰经济在第一季度出现部分反弹，这可能有助于整个欧元区摆脱浅度衰退。【原文：Ireland’s economy partially rebounded in the first quarter, a gain that may have helped the euro zone as a whole exit a shallow recession.】

item.title: 阿布扎比主权财富基金计划首次出售美元债券
item.description: 阿布扎比主权财富基金 ADQ 将跟随酋长国政府进入债务市场，发行首只美元债券。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s sovereign wealth fund ADQ is set to follow the emirate’s government into the debt market with its first dollar bond.】

item.title: 可可因中耕前景改善和看涨押注减少而下滑
item.description: 可可期货下滑，原因是西非的降雨提振了中期作物的前景，即使对冲基金继续削减看涨押注。【原文：Cocoa futures slumped as rains in West Africa boost mid-crop prospects even as hedge funds continue to cut their bullish bets.】

item.title: 从强劲的招聘到更多的住房，移民将如何促进美国经济？
item.description: 最近移民美国的人数激增，导致许多经济学家提高了他们的预测。现在，他们正在从数据中寻找更多的迹象来证明移民的影响。【原文：The recent surge in immigration to the US has led many economists to boost their forecasts. Now they’re looking for more signs of its impact in the data.】

item.title: 出口复苏乏力加剧越南和泰国货币困境
item.description: 亚洲新兴经济体的出口表现意外疲软，这有可能给本已因美元走强和美联储鹰派转向而遭受重创的这些经济体的货币带来更大压力。【原文：An unexpectedly weak exports performance in Asia’s emerging economies risks adding pressure to their currencies already hammered by a strong dollar and the Federal Reserve’s hawkish pivot.】

item.title: 韦丹塔寻求与贸易商达成交易，帮助为赞比亚铜矿筹资
item.description: 韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd）已与贸易公司接洽，寻求筹集资金以重振赞比亚孔科拉铜矿开采和冶炼联合企业。【原文：Vedanta Resources Ltd has approached trading houses as it seeks to raise capital to revive the Konkola copper mining and smelting complex in Zambia.】

item.title: 极端天气肆虐南方，暴雨威胁中国水稻生长
item.description: 据预测，未来几天中国将有更多的暴雨，这使人们担心这个世界上最大的水稻生产国和消费国的一些地区的早稻作物可能会受损。【原文：China is forecast to get more heavy rain in the coming days, raising concerns that early rice crops in some areas of the world’s biggest producer and consumer might get damaged.】

item.title: 据美国广播公司报道，所罗门群岛亲华领导人索加瓦雷退出总理竞选
item.description: 据澳大利亚广播公司（Australian Broadcasting Corporation）报道，所罗门群岛总理马纳塞赫-索加瓦尔（Manasseh Sogavare）在其执政党未能在议会选举中赢得多数票后，退出了继续担任太平洋岛国领导人的考虑。【原文：Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare has withdrawn from consideration to continue as the leader of his Pacific island nation after his ruling party failed to win a majority in parliamentary elections, the Australian Broadcasting Corporation reported.】

item.title: 肯尼亚敦促为世界银行分支认捐创纪录的 1200 亿美元
item.description: 肯尼亚总统威廉-鲁托敦促世界银行成员在下一轮融资中向该组织的优惠贷款部门提供创纪录的捐款，以有效应对发展中经济体面临的多重危机。【原文：Kenyan President William Ruto urged World Bank members to make record contributions to the organization’s concessional lending arm in the coming funding round to effectively deal with multiple crises facing developing economies.】

item.description: 在全球油价稳定的背景下，中国石油天然气股份有限公司（PetroChina Co.【原文：PetroChina Co. recorded its highest first-quarter profit amid steady global oil prices and even as China’s economic rebound struggles to gain traction.】

item.title: KKR 正与私人信贷基金洽谈为 Perpetual 竞购融资事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.已与多家私人信贷基金就至少 8 亿澳元（5.25 亿美元）的一揽子债务计划进行了谈判，以支持其对 Perpetual Ltd. 旗下企业信托和财富管理部门的竞购。【原文：KKR & Co. has held talks with a number of private credit funds for a debt package of at least A$800 million ($525 million) to support its bid for Perpetual Ltd.’s corporate trust and wealth management units, according to people familiar with the matter.】
